changelog.title: Manual Audit
changelog.content:
Bigger, Better Rewrite

We just updated the Rewrite feature so that it can be used on up to 9,000 words. We also changed the model powering it. Rewrite now uses Muse, so you get the highest quality rewrites possible. Happy writing!

affected_articles.contradiction: Docs state Rewrite can be used on 'up to 6000 words', but changelog announces it now works on 'up to 9,000 words'
affected_articles.existing_passage: Just highlight a section you'd like to rewrite, up to 6000 words, then click Rewrite.
affected_articles.corrected_text: Just highlight a section you'd like to rewrite, up to 9,000 words, then click Rewrite.

affected_articles.contradiction: Docs state Rewrite uses an unspecified model/prose mode, but changelog announces 'Rewrite now uses Muse'
affected_articles.existing_passage: The other main way to edit is with what we call the Rewrite button. Just highlight a section you'd like to rewrite, up to 6000 words, then click Rewrite. A Rewrite selector will appear in the History bar, where you'll choose how you want the Rewrite to work—shorter, more show, not tell, or even if I want to do something custom.
affected_articles.corrected_text: The other main way to edit is with what we call the Rewrite button. Just highlight a section you'd like to rewrite, up to 9,000 words, then click Rewrite. Rewrite now uses Muse, our flagship fiction model, to deliver the highest quality rewrites possible. A Rewrite selector will appear in the History bar, where you'll choose how you want the Rewrite to work—shorter, more show, not tell, or even if I want to do something custom.

result.summary: Two contradictions found in the Rewrite article: (1) word limit increased from 6,000 to 9,000 words, and (2) Rewrite now explicitly uses the Muse model for higher quality output. Both changes are factual corrections to existing documentation.
